It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and related plants. Its flowers are clustered in dense, spike-like inflorescences, and it typically grows in moist, swampy environments. Scleria scrobiculata is often found in wetlands, marshes, and along the edges of rivers and lakes.
